DataElement.preferredName: Adrenal Cortical Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the adrenal cortical cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adrenal Cortex Carcinoma Clinical M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

Concepts.definition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/9/17 tt transferred context; changed Reg Status to Qualified. Created per request by COG for their APEC14B1 study in Rave. mc 8/25/15

ValueDomain.preferredName: Adrenal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Adrenal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adrenal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with distant metastasis.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
